incidents.name: Verify Affected

incident_updates.body: On December 21st between 02:17 UTC and 02:54 UTC, Verify experienced an increase in 5xx errors when creating verifications, as a cluster containing rules for a limited set of customers exceeded its network bandwidth, causing requests to be throttled.

incidents.name: Issue With Severless Functions and Assets

incident_updates.body: The incident causing high CPU for Serverless Functions and Assets has been resolved, except for a small number of customers. We are closing this incident and will reach out to these customers individually for further follow-ups.
Serverless Functions and Assets are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Serverless Functions and Assets are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating a service interruption with Severless functions and assets. Our engineering team is working on a resolution.  We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

After monitoring for some time, we started seeing a degradation of the service. We're still experiencing issues with Serverless Functions and Assets.  We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

This incident causing high CPU usage on Serverless Functions and Assets was prematurely resolved in one of our previous posts. Please refer to https://status.twilio.com/incidents/ypfl5v92zqvx for previous updates. We will continue to monitor for system stability. Our next update will be provided in 30 minutes. We apologize for the inconvenience and for any confusion this may have caused

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on  ~10% Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved and Super SIM is operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 30 min or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 17:30 UTC, we observed ~10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working on identifying and resolving the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue . Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Issue With Severless Functions and Assets

incident_updates.body: This incident related to High CPU on Serverless Functions and assets was resolved prematurely. Please refer to https://status.twilio.com/incidents/6h1bygs71f56 for further updates. We apologize for the inconvenience and for any confusion this may have caused.

Severless functions and assets are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating a service interruption with Severless functions and assets. Customer may experience invocation issues and inbound call failures. Our engineering team is working on a resolution. Customer can clear cache and refresh the page for a new attempt. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Call Issues in Programmable Voice Services

incident_updates.body: Programmable voice services were degraded for 75 minutes between 06:00 AM and 07:15 AM Pacific Time on 12/15/2023. During this period of time, Programmable Voice and Flex customers may have experienced an increase in latency for call creation and call transfers.  Customers would also have seen an increase in call failures and a spike of errors. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Customers Not Billed For Using Verify WhatsApp Channel

incident_updates.body: Between October 25th at 18:41 UTC and December 14th 20:15:49 UTC, some customers using the Verify WhatsApp channel for Verifications may not have been properly billed for October, November, and December. This issue has been mitigated and affected customers will be notified and billed properly.

incidents.name: Automated Alert: Minimal Customer Impact

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the 5xx Errors During Rtc-Services-Register Canary Deployment issue, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.

incidents.name: False Emails Triggered for Toll-Free Number Rejection

incident_updates.body: Twilio Toll-Free number registration email was degraded for 436 minutes between 14:38 and 21:54 Pacific Time on 12/13/2023. During this period of time customers may have received emails sent to the verifications notification email address related to a Toll-Free Number rejection. This is not spam and was caused by Twilio. The issue has now been resolved.
